## setupTLSClientAuth() function

Modify fetch options for a request authenticated with a client-side TLS certificate.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function setupTLSClientAuth(fetchOptions: any, keyFilename: string, certFilename: string, rejectUnauthorized?: boolean): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  fetchOptions | any | The fetch request option object to modify. (<code>init</code> parameter in \[\[fetch\]\] above) |
|  keyFilename | string | Name of the private key file in PEM format (e.g. beginning with <code>-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----</code>) |
|  certFilename | string | Name of the certificate file in PEM format (beginning with <code>-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----</code>) |
|  rejectUnauthorized | boolean | to validate the server's certificate, false (=default) to accept invalid certificates as well. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;void&gt;

## Example


```javascript
const init = {method: 'POST', body: '{"something": "secret"}'};
await setupTLSClientAuth(init, 'key.pem', 'cert.crt');
const response = await fetch(config, 'https://protected.example.org/', init);
assert.equal(response.status, 200); // 401 = invalid certificate

```
